DOC.HEAD: Church of God in Christ Bishop J.O. Patterson, 77, Dies of Cancer
DOC.TEXT: Presiding Bishop J.O. Patterson Sr. of the Church of God in Christ, who retired earlier this year in failing health, died Friday. He was 77. Patterson, leader of the church's 3.7 million members around the world, died about 6 a.m. at William F. Bowld Hospital in Memphis, said Elaine Newsome, spokeswoman of the denomination. Patterson was first elected presiding bishop of the church, the world's largest black pentecostal holiness denomination, in 1968. He was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in April but refused to be treated for the disease because, he said, ``The treatment of prayer is better than chemotherapy.'' Doctors in the spring thought Patterson would die by October, said David Hall, editor of the denomination's newspaper, Whole Truth. The bishop's family was working on memorial arrangements Friday morning, the church said.
